greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k): If n = k, then A(n,k) = n, otherwise 0, read by antidiagonals as A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), etc.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10585; the first 145 antidiagonals of the array
formula: If n = k, then A(n,k) = n, otherwise 0.
example: The top left 9 X 9 corner of the array:
mathematica: Table[Function[s, If[OddQ@ Length@ s, ReplacePart[s, {# -> #}] &[Ceiling[n/2]], s]]@ ConstantArray[0, n], {n, 15}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 04 2017 *)
program: def A(n, k): return n if n==k else 0
for n in range(1, 21): print [A(k, n - k + 1) for k in range(1, n + 1)] # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 03 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 03 2017
